solution_line_template: Since there are {num_clowns} clowns at the carousel this year, the candy seller sold {candies_per_person}*{num_clowns} = <<{candies_per_person}*{num_clowns}={candies_sold_to_clowns}>>{candies_sold_to_clowns} candies to all the clowns.
The thirty children also bought {candies_per_person}*{num_children} = <<{candies_per_person}*{num_children}={candies_sold_to_children}>>{candies_sold_to_children} candies in total.

Altogether, the candy seller sold {candies_sold_to_children}+{candies_sold_to_clowns} = <<{candies_sold_to_children}+{candies_sold_to_clowns}={total_candies_sold}>>{total_candies_sold} candies to the clowns and children at the carousel.
The number of candies the candy seller has left is {initial_candies}-{total_candies_sold}= <<{initial_candies}-{total_candies_sold}={candies_left}>>{candies_left}
